description.p: Born from the magic of an awakened mastiff archmage, the mastar are a species of humanoid canines. While most mastar bear the physical traits of one or more larger domestic dog breeds, such as mastiffs or huskies, others can have the traits of smaller dog breeds—or even wolves!
With a blend of humanoid and canine traits, the mastar often retain one or more of their ancestors’ animalistic instincts, if in a somewhat muted capacity.

Mastar names are short, simple, and without fuss. They rarely use surnames, but will often suffix their names in more formal settings by naming themselves as the child of one or both of their parents.

Male Mastar Names: Barbas, Bear, Cliff, Fen, Garm, Jax, Mo, Pako, Rigby, Rin, Rocco, Tol, Varis
Female Mastar Names: Anara, Falda, Fern, Kima, Maru, Meeki, Ney, Pepper, Saru, Sif, Vala, Vivi, Voja
Ability Score Increase. Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.
Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.
Size. You are Medium.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Canid Howl. As a bonus action, you can let out a deafening howl to embolden your allies or terrify your enemies. When you do, choose either Frightful Howl or Inspiring Howl. You can use your Canid Howl a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

Dog’s Fangs. You can use your fangs to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for your unarmed strike.
Dog’s Talent. Your canine physiology grants you proficiency in the Perception and Survival skills.

Sniffer. As an action, you may focus your nose on a creature or object that you can smell within 5 feet of you. You gain the following benefits, which last for 8 hours or until you use this trait again.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can let out a deafening howl to embolden your allies or terrify your enemies. When you do, choose either Frightful Howl or Inspiring Howl. You can use your Canid Howl a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Frightful Howl. Choose a hostile creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. If the target can hear you, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is 8 + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (you choose when you select this ancestry) + your proficiency bonus. On a failure, the target is frightened of you until the start of your next turn. A creature frightened in this way can still move towards you, but expends 2 feet of movement for every 1-foot it moves.
Inspiring Howl. You and each allied creature within 60 feet of you that can hear you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus, which last until the start of your next turn.

description.p: As an action, you may focus your nose on a creature or object that you can smell within 5 feet of you. You gain the following benefits, which last for 8 hours or until you use this trait again.
Creature. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based on smell to locate the creature, as well as on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track that creature via its scent.

Object. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based on smell to locate the object or the last creature that touched it in the past 24 hours, as well as on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track that object or the last creature that touched it in the past 24 hours via its scent.

sheet.description: Focus on a creature or object's scent within 5ft. For 8 hours, you have advantage on Perception/Survival checks to find/track it by smell.
